For small businesses that operate on credit, accounts receivable make up a large portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, the auditor will verify if there is sufficient evidence to support your claims about the accounts receivable balance. These claims are called assertions. The most common audit procedure for accounts receivable is confirmation, where the auditor will ask your clients to confirm their account balances. Understanding which assertions can be verified through confirmation helps you understand why your auditor may need to perform multiple audit procedures to verify the same account. This situation often occurs: you press the snooze button on your alarm clock once, twice, or even three times, and by the time you finally get out of bed, wash up, dress, and get ready to face the new day, you're already behind schedule. Usually, this results in you completely skipping breakfast. It turns out that your breakfast habits are a time-saving technique that should not be neglected. Firstly, research shows that eating a nutritious, protein-rich, and balanced breakfast every morning is an effective way to activate your brain, improve focus, and enhance performance. Additionally, eating breakfast is also associated with better weight control, as it provides energy for the body and may reduce hunger later in the day.

The vote ended a grueling debate that began on Wednesday morning, and was briefly suspended at 5am on Thursday, before concluding at 12am on Friday. Lawmakers ultimately passed the bill, which will allow for abortions in certain circumstances. Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's anti-harassment rules. On Monday, after Trump tweeted that North Korea "may not be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why it had not banned the president from using the service. Twitter's public policy account posted six tweets in which the company said it considered "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when deciding whether a user had violated its rules. Twitter said these considerations had long been used internally to decide the fate of problematic accounts. The company said its rules were intended to ensure that all users could use the service safely, but also took into account whether certain tweets had news value or served the public interest. In this case, Twitter considered Trump's tweets to be newsworthy and of public interest, despite being controversial, and therefore took no action.

German business confidence fell to its lowest level in two and a half years in October, marking a sixth consecutive monthly decline, dispelling any doubts that Europe's largest economy is being affected by the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of more than 7,000 companies, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The shadows over the German economy are growing darker," said Hans-Werner Sinn, president of the Ifo Institute. The euro fell to a one-week low against the dollar after the Ifo data was released, while European stocks turned negative. The German economy is seen as a key pillar of the euro zone, but it is also showing signs of fatigue.

On Friday, the Supreme Court directed the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to review a proposal by the Agra Municipal Corporation to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site. The controversy between the US intelligence agencies and their elected President Donald Trump is not only confusing but also a special case for evaluating the principles that should govern the relationship between national intelligence and political administration under a democratic system. In theory, an intelligence-based national security system is responsible for detecting and tracking any national security threats, whether external or internal, and is committed to eliminating them. However, it operates under the authorization of an elected political administration, which is the highest sovereign authority. Under a democratic system, the political administration is the ultimate embodiment and representative of national sovereignty. Therefore, the relationship between the national security system and the political administration is complex and subtle, requiring a balance to be struck to ensure that the national security system can effectively fulfill its duties while also being subject to the supervision and restraint of the political administration. This balance is crucial to ensuring the effectiveness of the national security system and the healthy operation of the democratic system. The controversy between the US intelligence agencies and President Trump highlights the importance of this balance and the complexity of the relationship between the national security system and the political administration under a democratic system.

Several bills in the New Jersey legislature have caught the attention of truck drivers and other road users in the state. Drivers who repeatedly drive drunk may soon face harsher penalties. Harrisburg, Pennsylvania -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's Office announced it will be providing more than $55 million in funding to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the funding will be allocated based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. All 66 counties in the state, except for Philadelphia, will receive funding, with each county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania receiving at least $57,000. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. The Harvey's Lake Volunteer Fire Department, located in the Back Mountain area of Luzerne County, dispatches volunteers around the clock to various locations throughout the county.

Brazil is currently implementing the "Brazil without Poverty" plan, a continuation of the successful "Zero Hunger" plan, according to Marques Portela. In 2003, former President Luis Inacio Lula da Silva launched the "Zero Hunger" plan, which is believed to have lifted 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the core actions of the plan was to provide free school meals to poor children, which were purchased by the government from family farms. This practice not only supported local small farmers but also provided high-quality nutrition to children from low-income families. The plan also provided cash transfers and vocational training to poor families, further improving their standard of living. Through these measures, the "Zero Hunger" plan achieved significant results in reducing poverty in Brazil.

Young African Americans believe computers are part of their future, but may be missing out on key opportunities to learn coding, develop apps and software, and leverage technology innovation, according to a new national survey. The authors of "The Digital Lives of African American Tweens, Teens, and Parents: Innovating and Learning with Technology" are Kimberly A. Scott, a professor of women and gender studies at Arizona State University, and Victoria J. Rideout, a consultant. The head of the United Nations fact-finding mission on the Gaza conflict, Judge Richard Goldstone, urged the international community to take action to end the impunity of Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory for violations of international law as he presented the mission's report to the Human Rights Council. After a three-month investigation, the four-member fact-finding mission concluded that Israel's military operation in Gaza from December 27, 2008, to January 18, 2009, seriously violated international human rights and humanitarian law, and that Israel's actions constituted war crimes and possibly crimes against humanity. The mission's report also found that Hamas had attacked civilians, violating international humanitarian law. Judge Goldstone emphasized that the international community must take action to hold Israel and Hamas accountable and ensure justice for victims.
